newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Prompt SIMEX Brent shade soft on selling interest.
newsitem.headline: Prompt SIMEX Brent shade soft on selling interest.

text.p: SIMEX June Brent crude futures settled a shade weaker on selling pressure with only a total of 65 lots changing hands, brokers said on Thursday.
June Brent settled on SIMEX at $18.09 per barrel, after hitting a high of $18.11. July was last traded at $18.19 per barrel with a total of 25 lots traded.
Broker said there were more selling pressure in the market but said levels could inch upwards when London opens.
NYMEX June crude was last traded on ACCESS at $19.68, up six cents from New York's close on Wednesday.
